title: Orionids 2025: Meteor shower caused by Halley's Comet peaks as two new comets cross the sky
summary: Comets Lemmon and SWAN will be at their brightest just as the annual Orionid meteor shower produced by Halley's Comet reaches its peak.

title: تدهور معيشة 78 في المائة من الأسر
summary: تراجع مؤشر الثقة لدى الأسر، خلال الفصل الثالث من السنة الجارية، مقارنة بمستواه في الفصل السابق، إذ انتقل من 54.6 نقطة إلى 53.6. ويحتسب المؤشر بناء على آراء الأسر حول تطور المعيشة والبطالة وفرص اقتناء السلع المستدامة وتطور وضعيتها المالية. وأفادت المندوبية السامية للتخطيط، في نتائج بحثأكمل القراءة »…
body: تراجع مؤشر الثقة لدى الأسر، خلال الفصل الثالث من السنة الجارية، مقارنة بمستواه في الفصل السابق، إذ انتقل من 54.6 نقطة إلى 53.6. ويحتسب المؤشر بناء على آراء الأسر حول تطور المعيشة والبطالة وفرص اقتناء السلع المستدامة وتطور وضعيتها المالية. وأفادت المندوبية السامية للتخطيط، في نتائج بحث أكمل القراءة » المقالة تدهور معيشة 78 في المائة من الأسر fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: How to See Comet Lemmon This October
summary: This long-duration comet will make its closest approach to Earth this fall, before disappearing into the outer solar system for another 1,000 years.

title: سقوط زعيم عصابة تختطف “الحراكة”
summary: ضحاياها من كل أنحاء المغرب تستدرجهم بإشهار على مواقع التواصل الاجتماعي أحالت عناصر الدرك الملكي بسلوان، أول أمس (الأربعاء)، على النيابة العامة بالناظور، زعيم عصابة، كان موضوع مذكرات بحث وطنية لتورطه رفقة مساعديه في عمليات اختطاف واحتجاز طالت شبابا من عدة مدن، بعد أن أوهمهم بقدرته علىأكمل القراءة » …
body: ضحاياها من كل أنحاء المغرب تستدرجهم بإشهار على مواقع التواصل الاجتماعي أحالت عناصر الدرك الملكي بسلوان، أول أمس (الأربعاء)، على النيابة العامة بالناظور، زعيم عصابة، كان موضوع مذكرات بحث وطنية لتورطه رفقة مساعديه في عمليات اختطاف واحتجاز طالت شبابا من عدة مدن، بعد أن أوهمهم بقدرته على أكمل القراءة » المقالة سقوط زعيم عصابة تختطف “الحراكة” fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: Is academic research becoming too competitive? Nature examines the data
summary:
Nature, Published online: 17 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03119-z

Applications for European research grants increased in 2025. Scientists say they’re feeling the competition.
body: Nature, Published online: 17 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03119-z Applications for European research grants increased in 2025. Scientists say they’re feeling the competition.

title: CO2 levels reach record new high, locking in more global warming
summary: Greenhouse gas concentrations increased by a record amount in 2024 as more carbon dioxide, methane and nitrous oxide became locked in Earth's atmosphere, a World Meteorological Organization report finds.

title: An Iranian volcano appears to have woken up — 700,000 years after its last eruption
summary: Taftan volcano near the border of Pakistan has shown signs of unrest in recent years.

title: Record-breaking 'dark object' found hiding within a warped 'Einstein ring' 10 billion light-years away
summary: Researchers have found a suspected clump of dark matter lurking within the luminous halo of a well-known "Einstein ring." The mysterious object, the smallest of its kind ever seen, could help shed light on the universe's missing matter.

title: 'Most pristine' star ever seen discovered at the Milky Way's edge — and could be a direct descendant of the universe's first stars
summary: Astronomers have discovered a surprisingly "pristine" red giant with the lowest concentration of heavy elements ever seen in a star. It is likely a direct descendant of one of the universe's first stars.

title: Chasing comets: How to photograph comets Lemmon and 3I/ATLAS
summary: Comets don't visit often — here's how to capture comet Lemmon, comet 3I/ATLAS, on your camera as they dance across our skies.

title: The problem with career planning in science
summary:
Nature, Published online: 16 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02900-4

Having too rigid a plan could result in exciting opportunities passing you by, warns Ottoline Leyser.
body: Nature, Published online: 16 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02900-4 Having too rigid a plan could result in exciting opportunities passing you by, warns Ottoline Leyser.

title: James Webb telescope finds something 'very exciting' shooting out of first black hole ever imaged
summary: Using the James Webb Space Telescope's infrared camera, scientists have captured the gigantic jet blasting out of M87* in a new light.

title: SpaceX’s Second-Gen Starship Signs Off With a Near-Perfect Test Flight
summary: This was the last flight of SpaceX’s V2 Starship design. Version 3 arrives next year.

title: A vaccine central in A(H5) influenza antigenic space confers broad immunity
summary:
Nature, Published online: 15 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09626-3

A high-resolution antigenic map of influenza A(H5) haemagglutinin (HA) enables the design of immunogenic and antigenically central vaccine HA antigens tha…
body: Nature, Published online: 15 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09626-3 A high-resolution antigenic map of influenza A(H5) haemagglutinin (HA) enables the design of immunogenic and antigenically central vaccine HA antigens that elicit antibody responses broadly covering the A(H5) antigenic space.

title: The quest to make babies with lab-grown eggs and sperm
summary:
Nature, Published online: 15 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03308-w

Sex cells made from scratch could revolutionize human reproduction. But researchers are struggling to translate promising results in mice into benefits fo…
body: Nature, Published online: 15 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03308-w Sex cells made from scratch could revolutionize human reproduction. But researchers are struggling to translate promising results in mice into benefits for humans.

title: UNESCO stands at a crossroads — researchers must back its new leader
summary:
Nature, Published online: 15 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03306-y

Khaled El-Enany, the agency’s first director-general from an Arab state, will lead the UN’s education, science and cultural organization through one of it…
body: Nature, Published online: 15 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03306-y Khaled El-Enany, the agency’s first director-general from an Arab state, will lead the UN’s education, science and cultural organization through one of its most severe tests.

title: Haunting image of a rare hyena lurking in a ghost town wins 2025 Wildlife Photographer of the Year award
summary: South African photographer Wim van den Heever has received this year's Wildlife Photographer of the Year award for his image of a brown hyena outside a ruined diamond mining town.

title: Astronomers spot the most powerful and distant 'odd radio circle' ever seen
summary: With help from citizen scientists, astronomers have found the most powerful and distant "odd radio circle" ever detected.

title: A massive weak spot in Earth's magnetic field is growing, scientists discover
summary: The South Atlantic Anomaly, a huge weak spot in the geomagnetic field off South America, has expanded and sprouted a lobe in the direction of Africa over the past decade.

title: Japan declares a flu epidemic — what this means for other nations
summary:
Nature, Published online: 14 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03367-z

Researchers say that the number of infections for this time of year is unusual.
body: Nature, Published online: 14 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03367-z Researchers say that the number of infections for this time of year is unusual.

summary:
Nature, Published online: 14 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03307-x

CRISPR-based tools can’t easily access the DNA in these organelles, but researchers are finding other ways in.
body: Nature, Published online: 14 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03307-x CRISPR-based tools can’t easily access the DNA in these organelles, but researchers are finding other ways in.

title: Inside our university’s mission to pivot to research
summary:
Nature, Published online: 14 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03301-3

Innovation is key to meeting today’s global challenges. This is why the University of Botswana, originally a teaching institution, is now fostering resear…
body: Nature, Published online: 14 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03301-3 Innovation is key to meeting today’s global challenges. This is why the University of Botswana, originally a teaching institution, is now fostering research, and others should take the leap.

title: Link between Cascadia and San Andreas Fault earthquakes discovered 30 years after lost vessel stumbled across key data
summary: Geological records hint that earthquakes at the Cascadia subduction zone might trigger the San Andreas Fault.

title: 'Planet Y' theory hints at hidden Earth-size world lurking in the solar system — and it could be much closer to us than 'Planet Nine'
summary: A new study has proposed the existence of Planet Y, an alternative Planet Nine candidate that is smaller and closer to Earth than the hypothetical Planet X, which astronomers have been hunting for almost a decade. However, the evidence for this newly theorized world is "not definitive."

title: Hidden 'doomed' star revealed by James Webb Space Telescope could solve decades-old mystery
summary: Researchers have identified a massive red supergiant on the brink of supernova in images from the James Webb Space Telescope, shedding light on a decades-old star mystery.

title: An 'ice tsunami' in 2024 ripped through the Yukon with such force it tore up trees and the riverbed
summary: Chunks of river ice tore down trees after a landslide caused a tsunami in the Yukon in December.

title: $100,000 quadrillion asteroid Psyche may be the product of metal volcanoes, study hints
summary: The metal-coated asteroid Psyche may have had eruptions of molten iron and nickel on its surface. This situation was more likely if the space rock is made of the same chemicals as metal-rich meteorites, a new study suggests.

title: Scientists 'reawaken' ancient microbes from permafrost — and discover they start churning out CO2 soon after
summary: Researchers incubated permafrost samples from Alaska at different temperatures and found that microbes from the last ice age can reactivate and resume breaking down carbon.

title: What if Christopher Columbus had never reached the Americas?
summary: How would history have unfolded if Christopher Columbus had never reached the New World?

Melina Maldonado Sandoval, a member of the Mayo-Yoreme Indigenous community, assists researchers in studying the risks of petrochemical manufacturing in t…
body: Nature, Published online: 13 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03315-x Melina Maldonado Sandoval, a member of the Mayo-Yoreme Indigenous community, assists researchers in studying the risks of petrochemical manufacturing in the Sinaloa region.

title: Economics Nobel prize won by researchers who showed how science boosts growth
summary:
Nature, Published online: 13 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03364-2

Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt share economics prize for work that underlines the importance of investing in research and development.
body: Nature, Published online: 13 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03364-2 Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt share economics prize for work that underlines the importance of investing in research and development.

title: What an academic misconduct accusation taught me about sharing research
summary:
Nature, Published online: 13 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02947-3

Posting preliminary results on my group’s website allowed someone to plagiarize our work, but it also exonerated us.
body: Nature, Published online: 13 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02947-3 Posting preliminary results on my group’s website allowed someone to plagiarize our work, but it also exonerated us.

title: Alchemy: discredited pseudoscience or chemistry’s worthy ancestor?
summary:
Nature, Published online: 13 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03309-9

A spirited tour of alchemy shows how it bridged everything from chemical reactions, medicine and craft to philosophy, art and religion.
body: Nature, Published online: 13 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03309-9 A spirited tour of alchemy shows how it bridged everything from chemical reactions, medicine and craft to philosophy, art and religion.

title: Physicists capture rare illusion of an object moving at 99.9% the speed of light
summary: For the first time, physicists have simulated what objects moving near the speed of light would look like — an optical illusion called the Terrell-Penrose effect.

title: Hubble went supernova hunting — and found something unexpected: Space photo of the week
summary: The Hubble Space Telescope reveals how color filters tease out the life cycles of stars in spiral galaxy NGC 6000 — while a surprise asteroid streaks through the frame.

title: Which planets are the youngest and oldest in our solar system?
summary: There are a couple of ways that scientists can date planets, so which planets formed first in our solar system?

title: Hidden, supercharged 'thermostat' may cause Earth to overcorrect for climate change
summary: Rising levels of CO2 in the atmosphere may trigger a series of geological and biological processes that could ensure the next ice age arrives on time instead of being delayed, researchers say.

title: Up to 20,000 coins from Early Middle Ages discovered by man digging for worms near Stockholm
summary: A man digging for worms at his summer house in Sweden has unearthed a stupendous treasure: a silver hoard of up to 20,000 coins from the Early Middle Ages.

title: Einstein's relativity could rewrite a major rule about what types of planets are habitable
summary: Planets that orbit white dwarf stars should be too hot to host alien life, theories suggest. But a new study accounting for Einstein's general relativity may rewrite that rule.

title: China issues new pledge to cut greenhouse gas emissions — is it now a global leader in climate action?
summary: China has committed to slash its greenhouse gas emissions by 7% to 10% by 2035 — but is this going to cut it? Tell us what you think.

title: العناني أول مصري وعربي يتولى رئاسة اليونسكو.. والسيسي يهنئه
summary: ‏‎انتخب المجلس التنفيذي لمنظمة الأمم المتحدة للتربية والعلوم والثقافة (اليونسكو) بأغلبية ساحقة خالد العناني مرشح مصر لمنصب مدير عام المنظمة، وذلك خلال الانتخابات التي جرت الإثنين، حسبما أفاد المتحدث باسم الخارجية المصرية.

title: من المرشح المصري الأوفر حظا لقيادة اليونسكو؟
summary: يجرى الإثنين تصويت حاسم للمجلس التنفيذي لليونسكو، منظمة الأمم المتحدة للتربية والعلوم والثقافة، بهدف اختيار المدير العام المقبل، في خطوة تكتسب أهمية فائقة، إذ سيتولى الفائز قيادة المنظمة لـ4 سنوات وسط اتهامها بأنها "مسيسة"، وفي ظل الارتباك الذي أحدثه إعلان الولايات المتحدة خروجها منها.

title: إغلاق قناة "ناصر".. وأسرة عبد الناصر تتحرك لإنقاذ الأرشيف
summary: أقدمت منصة "يوتيوب" على إغلاق قناة "Nasser TV (ناصر تي في)" التي كانت تبث تسجيلات نادرة للرئيس المصري الراحل جمال عبد الناصر، في خطوة أثارت تفاعلًا واسعًا خلال الساعات الماضية، وسط سعي أسرته لاستعادتها أو البحث عن بدائل لنشر باقي تسجيلاته النادرة.
